SENT.plain: In this retrospective study over six years the authors report 65 malignant solid tumours of the children under the age of 15 years old
The average age was 7.9 years with a peak of frequency between 5 and 9 years
There was a male prevalence with a sex-ratio of 1.3
The most frequent histological types were: lymphoma of Burkitt (52%), retinoblastoma (20%), nephroblastoma (9%) and malignant tumours of the soft tissues (6%)
The malignant solid tumours of the child are relatively rare and histologically very diversified
